Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2009 04:46PM tapmrv wrote: I too had insurance problems last year regarding Avastin/Abraxane.  They kept pointing to each other as well.  I finally "LOST" it with the insurance rep and told her that it sounded like they would have much rather that I had done nothing and just died!  It was then that I was offered a case "psychologist" who could help me with my daily issues in handing my treatment.  I asked the lady, "Do you mean "shrink" because I am nuts?"  Told her I was just fine, knew what I was doing, and just needed her to do her job.  I received weekly updates from her and the "issues" were taken care of in a month. Stay firm and do not give up.  "Loose it" if you have to. Teresa
Posts.Title: Angry!!!! Insurance Issues Analemma Analemma

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2007 10:43PM tapmrv wrote: Bimmer, You are an inspiration!  My thoughts and prayers have been with you all day.  Had a treatment today and thought of you and Diane often as a looked around the room at the various stages of the cancer patients in the room.  Read your posts early this morning and agree that it is a fight to get to the next level.  I firmly believe that a new breakthrough is around the corner.  Just need to hang on and reach the next breakthrough.  This is what keeps me going, as well as my family (3 kids - 6,10,14) Praying for you and Diane.  Praying that she is strong enough to reach the next breakthrough. New to this board.  New to the advanced stage of this disease.  Original diagnosis was Sept 04.  Advanced stage was April 07.  Many ups and downs with this stage.  Many unknowns. Just wanted to let you know that I am pulling for you and Diane

Posts.Content: tapmrv wrote: I will be having Stereotactic Radiosurgery on a small spot on the back of my brain on Thursday.  Would like to get some feedback from anyone who has had this done.  So far, the process has been to have 3 small gold beads inserted into my skull; an MRI completed; and a mask made that will be used during the treatment.  Everything seems to be going fine up to this point.  Just wanted to see if anyone knew of any issues that will come up the day of the treatment. Thanks for your help, Teresa Dx 4/18/2007, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, 4/17 nodes, mets, ER+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
